definition: to do/to grow/to write or compose/to pretend/to regard as/to feel/writings or works

sentences.english: It is a typical imperial-court decorative painting of Song Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 该画为典型的宋代院体画，是工笔重彩画中的佳作。

sentences.english: Only you can hear me Summoner, what masterpiece shall we play today?
sentences.chinese: 只有你能听到我，召唤师，今天要演奏哪段佳作？

sentences.english: Since this year, an excellent work of short-short supermarket still is chosen to carry by offprint ceaselessly.
sentences.chinese: 今年以来，小小说超市的佳作依然不断被选刊选载。

sentences.english: His meticulously engraved works are all excellent.
sentences.chinese: 经他精心刻镂的雕塑作品，全都堪称佳作。

sentences.english: It was a poem of centuries.
sentences.chinese: 它是一首能彪炳若干世纪的佳作。

sentences.english: It is not correct to guess that there is pessimism and passive attitude in this poetic masterpiece through the ages.
sentences.chinese: 不可以消极悲观的情绪与观点去理解这首千古佳作。

sentences.english: Become a connoisseur of the best things other people have done.
sentences.chinese: 让自己成为一个鉴赏家，鉴赏那些由他人完成的佳作。

sentences.english: This article is clear in its theme, and logical in its structure.
sentences.chinese: 篇文章文理显豁，主题清楚，是篇不可多得的佳作。

sentences.english: Lyrics of these songs include many excellent literary masterpieces.
sentences.chinese: 东北抗联歌词中不乏文采飞扬的佳作。

sentences.english: The most unfortunate people in the world are those who have never discovered how satisfying it is to read good books.
sentences.chinese: 世上最不幸者就是那些从未领略过阅读佳作乐趣的人。

sentences.english: His meditative poems are his supreme achievement, many of which have become classics.
sentences.chinese: 他的冥想诗成就相当高，很多已经成为传世之佳作。

sentences.english: The novel is considered a brilliant performance.
sentences.chinese: 这部小说被认为是出色的佳作。

sentences.english: Her uncle took these photos and composed the master piece on teaching people to chant Amitabha.
sentences.chinese: 她的叔叔拍了这些相片并将之组成教人念佛的佳作。

sentences.english: The later works are the composer's best.
sentences.chinese: 晚期作品是这位作曲家的佳作。

sentences.english: In 2010, National Art and Design Competition, Excellent work award.
sentences.chinese: 2010年，作品入选全国美术与设计大赛，佳作奖。

definition: to put effort into (work, farming, writing etc)/a masterpiece
representative work (of an author or artist)
handed down from ancient times/family heirloom
to create/to produce/to write/creative work/creation/CL:個|个[ge4]
understanding and enjoying (a work of art)
not follow the beaten track/have an original style
to be worth reading a hundred times (idiom)
